benchmark_details.name: InsiderFilingDelay (IFD)
benchmark_details.overview: The InsiderFilingDelay (IFD) dataset is the first large-scale, behavior-rich dataset specifically curated for detecting delayed insider filings in violation of SEC rules, containing over 4,051,143 labeled SEC Form 4 transactions from 2002 to 2025, enriched with structured attributes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset and framework for studying insider filing violations and regulatory compliance in financial markets.

data.source: Extracted from WRDS and processed in SAS, focusing on valid trades and excluding amended filings.
data.annotation: Annotated with binary labels indicating compliance or violation, and enriched with over 50 features.

methods: Hybrid framework combining Mamba-based sequence modeling with XGBoost classification
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the binary classification outcomes of the insider filing delays.
methodology.interpretation: High values of Precision, Recall, and F1 Score indicate strong models in detecting violations.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against classical statistical models, deep learning baselines, and large language models with MaBoost outperforming them.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation and hold-out sets for performance evaluation.
